forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 52. West southwest wind around 6 mph.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny, with a high near 60. West southwest wind 5 to 13 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph.

weather_report:
In the embrace of early morning, a dense quilt of clouds blankets Downtown San Francisco, invoking a familiar serenity that often graces the city. The air whispers of a mild night, resting gently at around 52 degrees, with a hint of a west-southwest wind that carries the promise of a more robust day ahead. As the sun begins its ascent, the days ahead call for a gentle awakening, where the clouds will playfully part to reveal a partly sunny disposition, with the temperature climbing to a comfortable near 60 degrees.

The current conditions suggest a muted clarity, painted with shades of gray, likely concealing any lingering fog along the bay and the greater expanse. One can imagine the soft caress of the marine layer, weaving through the coastal hills, momentarily shrouding the iconic Golden Gate Bridge. As the warmth of the day unfolds, layers of light attire will prove to be prudent; a breathable jacket or a light sweater will keep one at ease against any unpredictable breezes while allowing for the eventual warmth that will seep through the clouds. With the day stretching before you, it’s an opportune moment to wander the vibrant streets of the city, perhaps to uncover a hidden café or stroll along the waterfront, relishing the subtle transformations of both sky and mood that mark this quintessentially San Franciscan day.
